attributes.action: To express concern at the harsh sentence handed to Muntazer al-Zaidi (the shoe throwing Journalist) and to use British influence to try and lessen his punishment on appeal.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: George Bush is a highly decisive character and his presence in Iraq is only tolerated by virtue of the Anglo-American occupation of that country.  Mr  al-Zaidi’s actions were wrong in law, however George W Bush is seen by Countries other than our own as international felon and his presence was always likely to cause offence.  To parade the outgoing president at such a time was incitement. Muntazer al-Zaidi actions were calculated to insult rather than harm.  Therefore a custodial sentence is highly inappropriate.

rejection.details:
A petition on this subject already exists on the site:

http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/freeshoethrower/

E-Petitions Team
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
